title: Mock Test 1
subject: Biology
description: A 15-question mock exam covering key Grade 10 Biology concepts from the Zambian syllabus including cells, nutrition, respiration, and classification.

questions.question: Welcome to the **Grade 10 Biology Mock Exam**. This paper consists of 15 questions covering various biology topics. Read each question carefully before answering.
Which organelle is responsible for energy production in a cell?
questions.explanation: The **mitochondrion** is the powerhouse of the cell, responsible for cellular respiration and energy (ATP) production.

questions.question: Which of the following best defines osmosis?
options: Movement of solutes from high to low concentration
Movement of water from high to low concentration across a selectively permeable membrane
Movement of molecules against a concentration gradient
Equal distribution of particles in a solution
questions.explanation: Osmosis is the movement of **water molecules** across a selectively permeable membrane from an area of high water concentration to an area of low water concentration.

questions.question: Name the process by which green plants manufacture their own food using sunlight.
questions.explanation: Photosynthesis is the process by which green plants use **sunlight** to synthesize food from **carbon dioxide** and **water**.

questions.question: **Section: Nutrition and Digestion** — The following questions test your knowledge on how living organisms obtain and use food.
Which enzyme is responsible for breaking down starch into maltose in the mouth?
questions.explanation: Amylase, specifically **salivary amylase**, begins the breakdown of starch in the mouth.

questions.question: State one function of bile in the digestive system.
questions.answer: emulsifies fats, breaks down fats into droplets
questions.explanation: Bile emulsifies large fat droplets into smaller ones, aiding the action of **lipase** during digestion.

questions.question:
**Comprehension Passage** — Read the passage below and answer the questions that follow.

A student conducted an experiment to test the effect of light intensity on the rate of photosynthesis. He used a water plant placed in a beaker of water and varied the distance of a lamp to measure the number of bubbles produced in one minute. He found that as the lamp got closer, more bubbles were produced, indicating a higher rate of photosynthesis.
What variable was the student changing in the experiment?
questions.explanation: The student changed the **distance of the lamp**, which affects **light intensity**.

questions.question: What was the dependent variable in this experiment?
questions.answer: number of bubbles, rate of photosynthesis
questions.explanation: The **rate of photosynthesis**, measured by the **number of bubbles**, is the dependent variable.

questions.question: Which component of the blood is primarily responsible for clotting?
questions.explanation: **Platelets** are fragments of cells that help in blood clotting by forming a plug at the site of injury.

questions.question: **Section: Respiration** — Answer questions related to aerobic and anaerobic respiration.
What is the word equation for aerobic respiration?
questions.answer: glucose + oxygen → carbon dioxide + water + energy
questions.explanation: The standard word equation: **glucose + oxygen → carbon dioxide + water + energy (ATP)**.

questions.question: Which of the following occurs during anaerobic respiration in humans?
options: Production of carbon dioxide and water
questions.explanation: **Lactic acid** is produced in muscles during anaerobic respiration due to lack of oxygen.

questions.question: **Section: Classification** — Questions here assess your knowledge of grouping organisms.
To which kingdom do **mushrooms** belong?
questions.explanation: Mushrooms are non-green and reproduce using spores, placing them in the **Fungi** kingdom.

questions.question: Which level of classification is more specific than class?
questions.explanation: The sequence is: **Kingdom → Phylum → Class → Order → Family → Genus → Species**.

questions.question: Give one reason why viruses are not classified under any of the five kingdoms.
questions.answer: not made of cells, cannot reproduce on their own
questions.explanation: Viruses lack cellular structure and can only reproduce within a host cell.

questions.question: Which characteristic is shared by both plants and animals?
questions.explanation: Both plants and animals are **multicellular** organisms.

questions.question: What is the primary role of the xylem in plants?
questions.explanation: The **xylem** transports water and dissolved minerals from the roots to the rest of the plant.
